pullrequest.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

content.raw:
That's easy. Just use my checklist:

* do the RAII thing (big ctors and dtors make for less preconditions checking in methods).
* don't violate the liskov substitution principle
* methods (especially in the public interface) should be callable from any state, once your object is initialized
* make sure that object is always left in a correct state after a method call, even when exception is thrown
* always make querying methods separate from methods that change the state
* Prefer references to pointers, unless NULL is a valid value.
* Answer the following question: If its only done in one place, why is it in a separate method?
* Give up. Object Oriented is just a style, it doesn't help us make better programs.
